org.biopax.validator.api.beans

Class Validation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Validation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Validation
extends Object
implements Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Validation.Identifier
      This is a generic functional object (strategy) interface that contain the only method, which is called by the validator framework to get an identifier or name of a model element to report an error about.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Validation

        public Validation(Validation.Identifier idCalculator)
        Default Constructor (this is mainly for OXM)
        Parameters:
        idCalculator - a strategy object to get a domain-specific identifier (for reporting)

      • Validation

        public Validation()
        Default Constructor (this is mainly for OXM)

      • Validation

        public Validation(Validation.Identifier idCalculator,
                  String description,
                  boolean autoFix,
                  Behavior errorLevel,
                  int maxErrors,
                  String profile)
        Non-default settings Constructor. Default values will be used if null or zero values were provided.
        Parameters:
        idCalculator - a strategy object to get a domain-specific identifier (for reporting)
        description - default is "unknown"
        autoFix - default is false
        errorLevel - default is WARNING
        maxErrors - default is 0 (means unlimited, actually it's Integer#MAX_VALUE, but the effect is same)
        profile - validation profile name (if null, the default is used)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when maxErrors < 0

      • getError

        public Collection<ErrorType> getError()
        List of error types; each item has unique code. (Note: the property name is 'Error', and not 'Errors', simply for the simpler object-XML binding.)

      • addError

        public void addError(ErrorType e)
        Adds or updates the error (with cases) to the errors collection. This is the primary method to save or update a just discovered or fixed validation problem! If the same 'error' already exists there (i.e. type:code where type is either 'warning' or 'error'), the new error cases will be copied to it; otherwise, the new one is simply added to the set. It also updates the notfixed errors counter, taking into account current validation threshold (level) and error's own type Behavior set by a validation rule that created it!
        Parameters:
        e - Error type
        See Also:
        setThreshold(Behavior), ErrorType.hashCode(), ErrorType.equals(Object)

      • removeError

        public void removeError(ErrorType e)
        Removes the error type and all cases.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • countErrors

        public int countErrors(String forObject,
                       String reportedBy,
                       String code,
                       Category category,
                       boolean ignoreWarnings,
                       boolean ignoreFixed)
        Counts the number of errors/warnings. Extra parameters are used to exclude some of the cases.
        Parameters:
        forObject - when 'null', counts all
        reportedBy - when 'null', counts all
        code - when 'null', counts all
        category - when 'null', counts all
        ignoreWarnings - do not count WARNINGs
        ignoreFixed - do not count fixed
        Returns:

      • getObjects

        public Set<Object> getObjects()
        Objects associated with this validation by the Validator, usually - indirectly, during I/O operations. Any object O can be potentially linked to the Validation object if it makes sense, and if there is a Rule or some method (such as in AOP Aspects) which is about to register errors about O.
        Returns:

      • isFix

        public boolean isFix()
        Returns:
        true if auto-fix is enabled; otherwise - false

      • setFix

        protected void setFix(boolean fix)
        Parameters:
        fix - true when auto-fix is enabled

      • getThreshold

        public Behavior getThreshold()
        Gets the error reporting level/threshold, i.e., this is to ignore issues reported with a level less than desired; e.g., to hide warnings (similar to logging).
        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • setFixed

        public void setFixed(String objectId,
                     String rule,
                     String errCode,
                     String newMsg)
        Finds a previously reported by the rule error case and marks it as fixed.
        Parameters:
        objectId - model element identifier (associated with the error)
        rule - a validation rule name (that reports the error code)
        errCode - specific error code
        newMsg - a message, if not null/empty, to replace the original one

      • getMaxErrors

        public int getMaxErrors()
        Errors limit. After this value is reached, the validator stops registering new error cases with this validation object (though rules continue to check and report). If this method returns 0 that actually means "not set", which also means 'unlimited' (this is to avoid generating unnecessary XML attribute value, such as Integer.MAX_VALUE).
        Returns:
        the max no. errors to be collected, or 0 if isMaxErrorsSet() returns 'false'

      • setMaxErrors

        protected void setMaxErrors(int maxErrors)
        Sets the errors threshold (max no. errors to collect/report), an integer value between 0 and Integer.MAX_VALUE, otherwise it has no effect (isMaxErrorsSet() will return 'false').
        Parameters:
        maxErrors -

      • isMaxErrorsSet

        public boolean isMaxErrorsSet()
        Returns:
        true iif maxErrors is greater than 0 and less than Integer.MAX_VALUE

      • getProperties

        public Properties getProperties()
        Gets normalizer settings.
        Returns:

      • getProfile

        public String getProfile()
        Validation profile to used when checking/reporting issues.
        Returns:
        the profile

      • setProfile

        protected void setProfile(String profile)
        Sets the validation profile to use when checking/reporting issues.
        Parameters:
        profile - the profile name

      • identify

        public String identify(Object obj)
        Gets a domain-specific identifier for a model element, stream, parser, etc. objects related to this validation. (for error reporting)
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:
